title: IRSA releases 201,800 cusecs water
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 24 (APP):Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Sunday released 201,800 cusecs water from various rim stations with inflow of 161,100 cusecs.
According to the data released by IRSA, water level in River Indus at Tarbela Dam was 1547.36 feet and was 149.36 feet higher than its dead level of 1,398 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam was recorded as 96,700 cusecs and 110,000 cusecs respectively.
The water level in River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1230.85 feet, which was 180.85 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded 10,600 cusecs and 38,000 cusecs respectively.
The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa , Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 117,700, 117,500, 99,900 and 43,300 cusecs respectively. Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 21,700 cusecs of water released at Nowshera and 4,700 cusecs released from River Chenab at Marala.
